item.title: installing docker on alpine linux
item.description: Prerequisites One raspberry pi zero W One sd card Enable all cgroups On you local linux, mount the partition containing alpine files. In the cmdline.txt, add the following: ... cgroup_enable=memory cgroup_enable=cpuset swapaccount=1 Docker needs all cgroups enabled, so this will do the trick On you rpi0 As simple as: apk add docker rc-update add docker boot reboot and check that everything is ok: docker run --rm hypriot/armhf-hello-world You should see some text if everything is working

item.title: installing alpine linux on rpi0
item.description: Prerequisites One raspberry pi zero W One sd card Download Alpine linux We’ll use the almost latest version: 3.9.2 (3.9.3 would not work for some reason) The one to use for RPI is the raspberry pi (surprising :P) armhf. On your local computer (assuming you re using linux) Mount the sdcard (should be automated, if not, you probably know how to do that and you probably don’t need that tutorial)
